metadata.title: CVE-2019-20425 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
In the Lustre file system before 2.12.3, the ptlrpc module has anout-of-bounds access and panic due to the lack of validation for specificfields of packets sent by a client. In the function lustre_msg_string,there is no validation of a certain length value derived fromlustre_msg_buflen_v2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-1008-raspi - 5.13.0-1008.9
linux-image-5.13.0-1008-raspi-nolpae - 5.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-raspi package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1008.9').
linux-gkeop package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gke package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-ibm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-22.22').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1003.3').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.6').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
